name: PointsFor3D
shortDescription: Adds points functionality to a 3d object just like the "Points" functionality in 2d sprites is.
description: You can define local coordinates of the object for 4 points.
The behavior automatically calculates the world positions of the points and saves them into the behavior properties.
You can call the values like this Player.Point3DBehaviour::Translated_X_1().

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Translates the given points in local space in relation to the parent object so you can place other objects at those points.
Works just like "Points" in the sprites.
You can call the translated information like this: Player.PointsFor3D::Translated_X_4().


Thank you to Davy (D8H), ZeroX4, Entr0py and Jurfix for the invaluable assistance in understandin how Java Script and behaviours work.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PointsFor3D

inlineCode: // --- Get source world position and rotation ---
const rotX = typeof source.getRotationX === "function" ? source.getRotationX() * Math.PI / 180 : 0;
const rotY = typeof source.getRotationY === "function" ? source.getRotationY() * Math.PI / 180 : 0;
const rotZ = typeof source.getAngle === "function" ? source.getAngle() * Math.PI / 180 : 0;
function rotateVector([vx, vy, vz], rx, ry, rz) {
[vy, vz] = [vy * cy - vz * sy, vy * sy + vz * cy];
[vx, vz] = [vx * cx + vz * sx, -vx * sx + vz * cx];
[vx, vy] = [vx * cz - vy * sz, vx * sz + vy * cz];
// Store all local points from behavior
// Variables of source to store results
// Process each point: rotate and convert to world space
const [dx, dy, dz] = rotateVector([lx, ly, lz], rotX, rotY, rotZ);
const [dx, dy, dz] = rotateVector([lx, ly, lz], rotX, rotY, rotZ);
// --- Save to behavior properties instead of object variables ---
